title: What is the logic behind the Le Blanc revert?

replies.body: Because old Leblanc is fun to play against :) Hold one second while I throw up.
"mages are dominant on midlane" something something.
So they decided to revert cancerblanc?

> [{quoted}](name=Project omen,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qQ5JaVHf,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-04-21T17:28:23.315+0000)
>
> So they decided to revert cancerblanc?

"She can't do crap against tanks so it is ok." Is their logic.
Ap itemization is so weak against MR now that a mere hexdrinker would prevent oneshots.
Then let's revert other champions as well. Remember stat check Vladimir pre rework? Let's revert him too.
they wanted to make faker stop crying

Probably because her rework left her unsatisfying to play as because of how awkward and clumsy her Mimic and passive were but also because she wasn't enjoyable to play against either due to her extreme safety.

Cause boards circlejerking.
Now watch the exact same people QQ about how OP she is and ask for another rework.

It's not a full revert.


They left her 2-mile long tether range intact =)
And now bring back the old Urgot!
riot sucks at what they're doing

Idk, they caved in to the QQ i guess.

LB is back to full cancer status, they'll quickly remember why the champ was reworked in the first place.
